AII IT Playbook v1.0

Cloud & Cost ManagementFinOps Guide

FinOps & Cloud Financials

30 min read

Strategic management of cloud costs to maximize business value through financial accountability.

Chapter 1

FinOps Overview

FinOps is an evolving cloud financial management discipline and cultural practice that enables organizations to get maximum business value by helping engineering, finance, technology and business teams to collaborate on data-driven spending decisions.

The Core Principles

Teams Need to Collaborate

Finance and engineering must speak the same language.

Decisions Driven by Business Value

Cloud spend should be an investment in growth.

Everyone Takes Ownership

Individual teams manage their own cloud usage.

Reports Should be Accessible

Cost visibility must be provided in near real-time.

Variable Cost Model

Take advantage of the pay-as-you-go nature of the cloud.

Centralized Team

A central team should manage discounts and commitment.

Chapter 2

Cost Visibility

You cannot manage what you do not measure. Proper allocation is the foundation of FinOps.

Tagging Strategy
Mandatory tags for all cloud resources at AXA.
Tag KeyDescriptionExample
EnvironmentDeployment tier
prod, dev, staging
ProjectCodeInternal budget code
AXA-2024-X
OwnerTeam or individual email
team-alpha@axa.com
ServiceTypeFunctional category
api, database, frontend

Untagged Resource Policy

Resources without mandatory tags are subject to automatic termination in development environments and escalation in production.

Chapter 3

Cost Optimization

Continuously optimizing your cloud footprint to eliminate waste.

Efficiency Techniques

Right-sizing

Select the most cost-effective instance type that meets performance requirements.

Orphaned Resources

Identify and delete unattached EBS volumes, Elastic IPs, and old AMIs.

Stop/Start Schedules

Automatically shut down non-production resources during off-hours.

Commitment Models

Savings Plans
Up to 72% Off

Commit to a specific amount per hour for 1 or 3 years.

Reserved Instances
Up to 60% Off

Reserved capacity for specific instance types or regions.

Spot Instances
Up to 90% Off

Use spare AWS capacity for fault-tolerant workloads.

Chapter 4

FinOps Culture

Moving from "Centralized Control" to "Distributed Ownership".

Engineer

Responsible for cost-efficient architecture and resource selection.

Finance

Monitors budgets, forecasts, and performs variance analysis.

Leadership

Sets cost-aware KPIs and fosters a culture of accountability.

Unit Metrics

Instead of asking "How much did we spend?", ask "How much did it cost to serve one customer?"

Chapter 5

Budgeting & Forecasting

Proactive cost management through alerts and predictive modeling.

The Forecasting Process

Analyze
Predict
Collaborate
Iterate
yamlSetting Budget Alerts (CloudFormation/Terraform)
MyBudgetAlert:
  Type: AWS::Budgets::Budget
  Properties:
    Budget:
      BudgetLimit:
        Amount: 500
        Unit: USD
      TimeUnit: MONTHLY
      BudgetType: COST
    NotificationsWithSubscribers:
      - Notification:
          NotificationType: ACTUAL
          ComparisonOperator: GREATER_THAN
          Threshold: 80
        Subscribers:
          - SubscriptionType: EMAIL
            Address: team-lead@axa.com
Chapter 6

Tools & Automation

Leveraging the ecosystem to automate FinOps activities.

Native AWS Tools

AWS Cost Explorer

Visualize and analyze your cloud spend.

AWS Budgets

Set custom budgets and alerts.

AWS Trusted Advisor

Automated cost optimization recommendations.

Cost & Usage Report (CUR)

Deep-level granular cost data.

Third-Party & Open Source

CloudCustodian

Policy-as-code for resource compliance and cost control.

KubeCost

Real-time cost monitoring for Kubernetes.

Apptio / Cloudability

Enterprise cloud financial management platforms.

Terratag

CLI tool for automated resource tagging.

Chapter 7

FinOps Maturity Model

Organizations evolve through three phases as they adopt FinOps practices.

1

Crawl

  • Basic tagging strategy
  • Monthly cost reviews
  • Reactive optimization
  • Siloed teams
2

Walk

  • Automated tagging
  • Weekly cost reviews
  • Proactive optimization
  • Cross-functional collaboration
3

Run

  • Policy-as-code enforcement
  • Real-time dashboards
  • Predictive optimization
  • Cost-aware engineering culture
Chapter 8

Case Studies

Real-world examples of FinOps success.

Right-sizing EC2 Fleet
$120K/year

Analyzed CloudWatch metrics to identify over-provisioned instances. Downsized 40% of fleet with no performance impact.

Spot Instance Migration
$85K/year

Moved batch processing workloads to Spot instances with proper interruption handling.

Reserved Instance Coverage
$200K/year

Achieved 70% RI coverage for steady-state workloads through centralized purchasing.

Chapter 9

Quick Reference Checklist

Actionable items to implement FinOps in your organization.

Visibility

  • Implement mandatory tagging
  • Set up cost allocation reports
  • Create team-level dashboards

Optimization

  • Enable Trusted Advisor checks
  • Review right-sizing recommendations monthly
  • Implement stop/start schedules

Governance

  • Define budget alerts at 50%, 80%, 100%
  • Establish anomaly detection
  • Create cost review cadence

Culture

  • Train engineers on cost awareness
  • Include cost in architecture reviews
  • Celebrate cost savings wins
